I like to enjoy the day as much as possible, usually through some sort of exercise like biking or disc golf.  I enjoy music, art, and having a good time.  

My travels so far have taken me to Chile, Argentina, Bolivia, Peru, Mexico, China, Thailand, Laos and all over the U.S.  I can speak English and Spanish. 

My company is called Dog Tag Art.  We make really neat, custom ID tags for pets.

You should come visit Asheville, I think you'll like it!

We LOVE alternative dwellings and micro housing. We ourselves live in a  270 sq ft vintage camper with our three dogs. We have really been enjoying the opportunity to share our land with guests and have met so many amazing people through hosting on AIRBNB.   Together, Josh and I own two pieces of land in Asheville. One has just the yurt alone on it. Our other property is home to Bettie and also has several private campsites. It's nice to be able to offer people a range of options- from camping on the cheap to enjoying a luxurious stay in our yurt or restored vintage trailer! Joanna owns an environmentally conscious cleaning company in Asheville, Clean Green Asheville. Josh makes tactical gear like tourniquet holders and works out of his airstream shop. We are both very friendly and active people and we do all of the work on both properties ourselves :-)

single mother of 2. I work a full time job at the hospital and just need to have some spending money.  Not out to get rich.  I like meeting new people and I have a room for rent.  Short term only, pets available for additional $20 per day.  Pet must get along with mine. I have a rescue that is 1 year old about 45 lbs and loves to play. I have a fenced yard for them and a wonderful neighborhood to walk in.  If you bring your dog we need to meet somewhere prior to you renting to see if they will get along.

We operate two traveler's hostels located in Historic West Asheville, and in Wilmington, NC. Both locations offer wifi and Internet access, full kitchen and bathroom, book exchange and common areas, and bikes to borrow.

Traveling all over the world inspired me to get my degree in Culinary Arts and inspired me to move to Asheville.  Great food and unique culture is hard to find in one place.  Somehow Asheville has managed to combine culture, art, great food, locally brewed beer, local farms, and local businesses into a charming town nestled into ancient mountains full of waterfalls, hiking, history, and art.

Asheville is one of the few places that has four beautiful seasons and some of the best coffee and restaurants around.  I am excited to open up my home to travelers and I'm looking forward to share all there is to experience in and around Asheville.

I've lived in Asheville for about 12 years and love being in the mountains.  My (almost) two year old son is a joyful and vibrant soul who loves music and dance, just like his Mama.  We are a community minded family with a fun, creative flair.

My husband and I have lived in our home for 17 years. We have two friendly male cats, Peanut and Chippie. We love good food, gardening, hiking and motorcycling.

I'm a Kripalu Yoga Teacher and teach full-time from my home studio.

5 Things I Love:
My husband, Greg
My cats, Peanut and Chippie
Long Walks in the woods
Breathing, Stretching and Contemplation
Laughter

Favorite Quote:
I am a part of all that I have met;
Yet all experience is an arch wheretho'
Gleams that untravell'd world whose margin fades
Forever and forever when I move. - Tennyson's Ulysses

Steve and Jen built this Arts and Crafts style home in 2010. We love West Asheville because of it's easy access to nightlife and shopping. We are antique dealers and build industrial furniture. I was a travel agent and love to travel the world. Our daughters are grown and gone. We have a small dog named Joe and a cat Amorous. They are cool. We travel to many antique shows through the year and buy and sell some unusual items. It's a great way to see the area and meet some characters. Our neighborhood is quiet and safe and our neighbors are our friends.

I recently graduated, I studied scenic design, theater and film. I am working for a renewable energy company. I volunteer for a design center.  I love to surf. I do a lot of sewing as a hobby. I have used Airbnb as a guest and have had great results and met wonderful people! Im excited I can return the favor and host my own guests.

We are three female roommates with a special knack for mixing drinks, preparing meals, making desserts and sharing our wonderful home. We take requests for all of the above and believe me, you should make them! We use our house, so expect to see us around. We are laid back and open to the needs of different guests, just communicate with us. Join us for a night on the town in Asheville or enjoy your privacy in our beautiful back yard.
Musician and artist who likes to travel. I'll probably have my fiddle with me!

Elizabeth Kirwin is the creator and founder of (URL HIDDEN) a website that gives insight into the fairy culture of the United States, a branch of neo-paganism that is on the rise.Â  Kirwin is a professional writer, performance artist and Organic SEO specialist.Â  Visit (URL HIDDEN) or email (EMAIL HIDDEN)

Our family has lived in this beautiful home for six years and we've put a lot of love and energy into it. We enjoy hiking, working in our yard, and spending quality time with one another and our friends. We love to travel and during our most recent stay in an airbnb in Scotland, we decided to open our home to travelers. We look forward to meeting you!

Hi, I am an artist living in the Western North area of NC.   I enjoy sharing my home with others and introducing them to the beauty of these amazing mountains.  I love to travel, draw, paint and sculpt. I also love to swing dance. Look forward to meeting amazing people from around the world through airbnb!
I like to work hard and play hard. I am easy going. I love travel and love hosting travelers. I am a father of a beautiful 18 year old.

I love living in Asheville!!! 
I am a generous, health conscious, independent gal who loves the outdoors- rivers, oceans and mountains! Asheville has been my home for 15 years- on and off- and I am 100% in love with my community here. I adore traveling yet equally love home and have worked hard to make mine comfortable for others- including you!!!

I have travel in my blood. I was born in Chateauroux, France. My sister was born in Germany and I learned to speak German when my family lived there for four years. Some of my favorites places include, Lagos de Atitlan, Uxmal, Merida, San Cristobal, Antigua, Ambergris Caye, Chichicastengo, Amsterdam, Vancouver, Cologne, Berlin and Prague. I prefer to travel off the "gringo trail" and have many more places to visit. Open to house trade.

I am a passionate student of compassionate communication (NVC). Two important things I've learned is that other people's behavior rarely has anything to do with me and that with patience and compassion, most all our needs can be met. 

For fun around here I have ridden a hot air balloon over our mountains, taken a mountain top zip line tour nearby, seen our ancient mountains during a flying lesson, rented a scooter and rode the blue ridge parkway, took a few archery lessons so I could pretend to be like Katniss from The Hunger Games, which was filmed nearby. I also enjoy sitting in the backyard watching my chickens do goofy things. What do you like to do for fun? Let me share more fun things to do in our beautiful mountains.
outgoing, sensitive, adventurous, trustworthy, healthy, loyal, responsible

After about a year of travelling, Katie and I decided to call Asheville our home in the spring of 2001.  We have really seen our small city grow and flourish.  Asheville continues to be an amazing place to live and raise a family.   As fellow travelers, we like to get a genuine feel for the places we visit and want for you to experience the best Asheville and the surrounding area has to offer.
Katie is a labor and delivery nurse and I have my own plumbing business. We have two kids, some dogs and some chickens. Life is good.

I have been here since 2007, and continue to fall more deeply in love with Asheville.  I adore my neighborhood, West Asheville.  It is super friendly and very community-oriented.  It truly has the charm of an old-fashioned neighborhood.
I love nature, gardening, yoga, cooking, travel, holistic health, movies, reading/learning, my cat, trees...

My husband Griff and I love to travel! One of our favorite things about traveling is all the people we meet, for this reason we love the idea of airbnb! We are new to the system, but we look forward to many wonderful stays and meeting some great people!

Asheville is really my favorite place I have ever experienced.  I lived in Colorado for nearly 16 years, but when I visited Asheville I knew that I had to move here. I love playing music, dancing and going out to the wine bar in downtown Asheville.  I'd love to  be your hostess and give you advice and tips on the great things to do, places to eat, and music to hear in this vibrant town. I also love nature and the outdoors, so being at the congruence of three ancient and beautiful mountain ranges, and easy driving distance to hikes, mountain peaks and water falls, is perfect for me!

We are from the Mountains of Western North Carolina. David is a contractor, specializing in GreenBuilding and Melissa is a Physician Assistant at a Family Practice. 
We to love travel, play outdoors with our dog and enjoy all the great restaurants Asheville has to offer.

I am one of the few natives of Asheville NC and have lived here on and off my whole life. I live here now with my partner Jason and three year old daughter. I am a local hair stylist and my partner works in construction. We love the area and are enjoying the new growth and development of this little city. We have found it to be super child friendly place to live and lots of fun with great folks.
I personally enjoy yoga, swimming , dancing, art and being with friends and family.
We love to travel in the winter times. I have lived in Europe, Central America and recently just moved back here from the bay area California.

A resident of Asheville for over 22 years. 

I love the local food scene here. I am happy to recommend anything from a simple hike with amazing views, to the spots to hang like a local. 

Let me know if you have any questions I am happy to help!

I am a former attorney turned actor and entrepreneur.  I own a company called Shift Bars- we make the world's first raw vegan zero-sugar energy bar and launch in late 2015. I love eating awesome, healthy food, hiking, watching movies, dogs and much more.  I love living here and am so excited to share it with you!

Life motto- "Life is not about finding yourself. Life is about creating yourself." George Bernard Shaw

I am a hardworking girl looking to travel a bit more! I taught school for over 9 years. Since then I have been trying my hand at several fields to see what is the perfect fit for me. I want to be able to make a few changes to my house and would love the opportunity to travel more. I thought airbnb would be the perfect opportunity! I have family all over the place right now: a brother in Japan, sister in Colorado, and a cousin in San Fran--all places I'd love to visit! I love all things silly and quirky especially a good British Comedy or Tom Robbins novel. Much of the reason I moved to Asheville is for the incredible variety of cheap, delicious food and beer. There's always something to do around here whether it's catching a new independent film, tubing down the French Broad River or tasting a new micro-brew!

My daughter Rosa and I share our West Asheville home with our indoor cat, Joey and our sweet dog, Fina.  We have been here for almost 10 years now.  We love to travel, camp, hike, and otherwise enjoy all that Western North Carolina offers.  I lived in Europe for two years and have subsequently traveled extensively, mostly in Central and South America.  I am a Spanish teacher and musician and love to work with children and adults.  I practice yoga, love to read, dance, eat out, and socialize, and feel fortunate to have wound up in this great city of Asheville with my fascinating and fabulous daughter.

I'm at home here in Asheville, the "Friendly City" where I get to enjoy the trails with my 2- and 4-legged friends, go out for fantastic meals, see touring music, try new brews every week, and appreciate art at every turn.  It's a great place to visit and I am happy to help with suggested sights!

Hi, I am an artist living in the Western North area of NC.   I enjoy sharing my home with others and introducing them to the beauty of these amazing mountains.  I love to travel, draw, paint and sculpt. I also love to swing dance. Look forward to meeting amazing people from around the world through airbnb!

About me: I enjoy mountain biking, flatwater kayaking, reading (mostly non-fiction/science/anthropology/psychology/history), photography, spending time with friends and family, and traveling internationally (30 countries so far, most recently in Panama, Morocco, and Poland).  

As an airbnb guest I'm clean, considerate, and respectful.  I like it best when I can spend a little time getting to know my host -- although this certainly isn't a necessity -- as I've met very interesting people this way.

As an airbnb host I want to make sure that my guests are very comfortable and that I'm giving them a great place to stay at a fair price.

My partner, Kevin, and I are avid Airbnb host and guest.  We love traveling and sharing our home in Asheville, NC with other travelers.  Through our adventures we have discovered just how beautiful this tiny little planet is.  We do our best to keep it that way.  We use all natural and homemade cleaning supplies, recycle, up-cycle, compost, grow our own, and share :) 
We have two big old dogs who have traveled almost everywhere with us.  They are respectful, calm, and adorable.
We are also interested in home swapping.

Well hello! I'm Morgan and I'm a long-time resident of Asheville, NC. I love it here in the mountains but am always looking to get out of town on an adventure.

I'm an entrepreneur of sorts in that I started a tree service with my brother in 2009 and I also have been working as a wardrobe stylist since 2010. I love the variety of my work and how one day I'll be chipping brush and the next I'll be dressing the Avett Brothers- it really is a blast!

I'm somewhat of a quiet person though I do enjoy getting together with friends or taking myself out for a night on the town. When staying at someone's house, I am always conscientious of that person's life and am very respectful of everything in their home; I hope you feel the same way!

Looking forward to sharing my home with you,

-MP

Our family has lived in this beautiful home for six years and we've put a lot of love and energy into it. We enjoy hiking, working in our yard, and spending quality time with one another and our friends. We love to travel and during our most recent stay in an airbnb in Scotland, we decided to open our home to travelers. We look forward to meeting you!

I am a hard working teacher. I like to walk, love to eat well and practice yoga. I love to read and learn and occasionally play some music or dabble in an artsy project. My partner and dog live here with me.

Ken is originally from South Florida, and Patti is originally from Southern California.  Ken moved to the mountains in 1982 and Patti moved in 1992.  We are both retired, and have four children and seven grand children between us.  We love the Mountains but enjoy getting away to the ocean where we are advanced scuba divers.  We also enjoy traveling and meeting new people.  Most recently, we went to the Southwest to visit Sedona, AZ; Cortez, CO; Bryce Canyon and Zion National Park, UT; and the southern Alaska area.  Several of our pictures from this trip appear in the rental suite.  We look forward to having guests in our recently renovated space, and if you're really lucky and ask really nice (and are here long enough), you might get some North Carolina BBQ (Ken is an excellent BBQ chef and cook).

I love Asheville! I have lived here most of my life. I graduated from Warren Wilson College with a BA in Philosophy but also studied the ecosystem with time spent working in native plant restoration. I love helping people explore the area. I like the natural world. Trees, plants, minerals, animals, air, and sometimes fire.

It's hard to believe that I've lived in Asheville for 10 years,  it has felt like home since the moment I moved here. I am fortunate to have a job that I love, a home to share, and an amazing community of friends.  There are so many things to see and do in Asheville. A few of my favorite are  riding my mountain in Bent Creek,  enjoying a good glass of red wine at Sante or the Battery Park Book Exchange, floating down the french broad river, frequenting the never ending list of eateries, seeing a show at the Orange Peel or Grey Eagle, and  catching a movie at the Fine Arts Theatre or the Brew and View. Sometimes you'll find me just being plain ol' lazy because the one thing I can't live without is a good nights sleep! I also enjoy reading a good book and making jewelry.

I'm an easy going person that is dependable. As your host, I will do my best to make sure that you are comfortable and have everything you need to make your stay enjoyable.

I'm an Asheville/WNC native.  I love hiking, mountain biking, fishing, camping and playing in our historic  and ancient mountains.   My vacation rental properties come with high speed internet, cable, Pandora, fully stocked kitchens, plenty of parking, DOG FRIENDLY and pretty much everything you will need to be able to relax and kick back.

My best friend Troy Pope and I are licensed NC Realtors and we can help you with vacation rentals as well as buying your new mountain home.

I look forward to sharing this area with you!

We are oriiginally from the northeast but have joined our two children and our grandchildren.  We live four hours away in Raleigh but visit often.  Can't get enough of those little ones.  We may or may not be in residence while you are here but are only a phone call away.

I am a full time, self-employed artist. My love for craft and art can be seen in my home- fine art, pottery, photography, sculpture. I have an affinity for cooking, growing things, building things, walking in the woods, and deep conversation.
I sell my artwork at craft shows across the country and discover amazing places along the way. But coming home to Asheville is always a blessing!
My space is welcoming, lovely, and quiet- but accessible to everything! I love my home and hope my guests will, as well.
I'm a lover of nature and life!  My partner is a woodworker and carpenter, and loves the forest!  We love hosting folks to Asheville!

I am a mom of two. I was a professional creative director until the birth of my two kids. They are my priority right now. I own my own home. Our house is a mid century modern, and our kids understand to be respectful of others property as well as of their own home. We live in the bay area. Piedmont - in Oakland. 

Thank you

We live in the beautiful mountains of Asheville, NC. Ali is an art therapist and loves being a witness and partner in the healing process. Dave is an entrepreneur and started his own company related to software testing. (Dave can pretty much do anything related to computers). We are pretty active and like to seek out hiking/biking/walking paths. And, we love to eat. Eating and drinking like locals is our most favorite fun way to get to know a new area. Our overseas adventures include Singapore, Malaysia, India, Costa Rica, and Argentina. We've had many memorable stays using airbnb and love the community feel of this way of travel.

We (my future husband, Jason, and our two dogs Harley and Wheat Thin) bought our house in April 2015 and are working hard on getting it to be a beautiful and cozy place to live. That's why we do Airbnb! So we can afford to make more improvements!  

We're a pretty chill household. We like to cook and watch movies. We also love rugby! After playing for 10 years, I have retired, but Jason still plays for Asheville. 

My favorite movie: Frida
Jason's favorite movie: Jaws 
Wheat Thin's favorite movie: The Muppets (because he is one)

Hello friends! 

I began traveling abroad at 18 and have traveled much of Latin America and the USA.  I'm fluent in Spanish and I'm studying Brazilian Portuguese and French.  Throughout my travels I've learned the importance and value of being a welcoming and obliging host, and the merits of being a humble and grateful guest.  It is my aim while hosting to provide my guests with a superb experience.  Whether you're looking for a brewery tour, exquisite culinary outing, or a peaceful waterfall hike, I'm happy to point you in the right direction!

I love to travel and have so far, enjoyed hosting.  My interests include the outdoors, anything physical, reading, cooking, trying different beers and gardening (often times the last two combined).  I'm in and out of my house a lot.  I'm easy to get along with and will do what I can to make sure my guests have a great experience in Asheville.

Divorced mother of 2. After 17 yrs of marriage I am on my own again.  I have a wonderful job at the Hospital, but still need to make ends meet.  therefore I have come to Airbnb to offer a space for people traveling and need a safe environment to sleep as well as I do.  I enjoy my kids, shopping, walking my dog Cody, cooking and just hanging out with friends.

I love to travel all over the world and meet people from all walks of life.  I am a Bicycle Tour Guide where I guide road bike tours all over the USA and some abroad. I also own a small handcrafted soap company.

If you are coming to hike or ride bikes I have safe storage for your bikes and I am happy to tell you about wonderful routes both road and mountain. I have lived in Asheville since 1999. Previously I lived in Delaware, Lancaster PA and Alaska.

We operate two traveler's hostels located in Historic West Asheville, and in Wilmington, NC. Both locations offer wifi and Internet access, full kitchen and bathroom, book exchange and common areas, and bikes to borrow.
I love to read, travel, and spend time with family. I also enjoy sharing how amazing Asheville is with other travelers!

Happy to have a home base in walkable West Asheville! 

Lover of travel, laid back people and local food!

Jakub and I have been together since 1999. We are both architects and we are both from Eastern Europe. We have two children, a boy and a girl. As a family we like hiking, mounting biking, travelling, creating art, reading and spending time with friends. We are planning a year of travel around the world November 2013- November 2014 and we are renting our house while away. We are very excited to share our home with others. We feel it is a special place and we hope you will enjoy it. What we most love about our home is its openness, the view of the trees, the quiet and the light.

We are both very laid back and truly love living in Asheville.  We hope to make your trip as comfortable as we can.  Tracy is a postal supervisor and Brent works as a nurse at our local VA.  We are looking forward to sharing our home with you.

My husband and I moved to Asheville from Chicago in December of 2010.  Can't live without live music, records, gettaways and our tent.  We love Airbnb and all the unique spaces we have found to stay using this site, including a barn in West Virginia and a treehouse in Santa Cruz!  Hope we see you soon!

I'm a Sundance filmmaker who appreciates health and wellness. Yoga, dance, mediation, film etc.. I'm positive minded and energy conscious. I love my friends and family. I am easy to get along with and I appreciate good communication and follow-thru! :)  
My partner Iz is a multimedia artist, specializing in writing and circus arts. She has been renovating the guest house for the past 10 years and is happy to share it with you on your visit!

Ron and I love hiking, gardening, good food and good art. We also love music, theatre, dance -- pretty much all visual and performing arts. We travel as much as we can. We both lived in Central America as children, and you'll see little bits of that around the house. 
This house has been our part-time home for years; and has served as "The Sanctuary" (so dubbed by our niece) for the whole family. Our daughter and son-in-law use it for weekends when he goes fly fishing and she visits friends; our son and daughter-in-law find it a nice change of pace from home. 
Our profile photo was taken when we were out sailing with good friends in San Francisco.
Cat and Jeff are healing arts practitioners. We are dedicated to this wonderful community and the preservation of the Appalachian mountains.

I'm a middle aged woman living a good life in Asheville with a home that was built to be shared. My daughter, Marina and I have have been here over 20 years and she assists with managing the rentals.We both love Asheville, and love our dogs, who you may meet in one of our locations; and consider ourselves Ambassadors of Asheville!

Walter, my husband & I have lived in Asheville for nearly 20 years now and love all that this magical place has to offer.  My husband is a high school building construction teacher and I am a residential designer.  In our free time, we like being outdoors playing or gardening. We have stayed in a few vacation rentals over the years which have inspired us to create our own to share with you.  Enjoy!

Craig and I moved into our newly constructed West Asheville home in May 2014. Santina is a retired psychotherapist who loves gardening, cooking, and meeting with friends. Craig is an Uber driver as well as a photographer/personal historian.

Our home is a wooded oasis just 2 miles from the center of West Asheville and 4 miles from downtown.  Deer, wild turkeys and rabbits are frequent visitors.

My wife, Cathy, and I are outdoor enthusiasts who are passionate about food and food justice.  We live in beautiful Asheville, NC.  We've both traveled extensively, having spent a lot of time in youth hostels, and are more found of European style B&B experiences than the posh US interpretation of B&Bs.  We don't require a lot of fuss; just looking for a comfortable bed and pointed to coffee/tea in the morning.
Single mom, massage therapist, herbalist, energy healer, and lover of life!  I am all about good communication, integrity,  kindness, and fun.

Hi there! My name is Dustin and I am a local artist and bartender in Asheville, NC. I run a studio on Haywood Road in West Asheville called 474 Gallery Studio (but sometimes its still referred to as "Spagnola," which is my last name.) I am currently bartending two nights a week at The Cascade Lounge which is nestled inside of the Asheville Food Park. I like to paint pictures on canvas and on walls. I love traveling and often go out of town to paint murals, sometimes alone, sometimes with friends. Places I have painted in the past include Miami, New York City, Atlanta, Memphis, Nashville, Charleston, and Kathmandu. All of this traveling has led me to stay at air bnb homes accidentally, and I love the service. I love travelling and I love exploring new places and not feeling like a tourist. I love to feel myself becoming integrated into every new place I go.  Feel free to check out my work on my website: dubyou dubyou dubyou dot dustin spagnola dot c 0 m.  I have a dog that I love very much, his name is Louie and he's a small doberman mutt.
I am a traveling yoga teacher, and artist.  I like to live close to the earth and healthy.

I enjoy people, hiking, writing, genealogy, painting, fixing things (like plumbing if it isn't too complicated), puttering in the yard, dogs, cats, and maybe some day.... chickens.  (We are allowed to have chickens in the city limits but no roosters.)  Our children are grown.  I am on a part-time schedule with consulting, and love hosting with airbnb.  With each new guest I am amazed anew at how many incredibly good, gracious people there are in the world.

My husband and I enjoy meeting people and sharing our vision for healthy homes and relationships. Our lives and work are focused on a mindful awareness, conscious communication, and community building. We love sharing our home with those wishing to visit the area to explore the beautiful Blue Ridge mountains along with the creative and progressive energy of Asheville....

I love sharing the energy these ancient mountains wrap us in while we are here.  My home is modest, but clean and I offer a chill place to return to after a great day of exploring. 

Lots to do from walking to hiking, biking, theatre, art strolls, great food. 
My joy comes from dance, biking, and gardening as well quiet times on the porch with a glass of wine or a beer and good company.

Nuthin fancy; just a gracious and clean space for good people.

I love living in Asheville, NC. I'm walkable / bike-able to everything I could possibly need. Asheville is a foodie town with amazing restaurants and some of the best breweries in the country. There's a great music and art scene, there is always plenty to choose from. 

I enjoy traveling too, some of my favorites include San Francisco, New York, Savannah, Colorado, New Mexico, and Toronto. I recently returned from 2 weeks in Brazil. 

I study endangered birds, play roller derby, and teach salsa and yoga.
I'm a globe trotting social worker. By living in villages abroad, I learned how great it is to live within walking distance to everything: food, drink, nice folks, music

I'm a travel blogger, social media marketer, and (EMAIL HIDDEN) who loves living in Asheville but always planning my next vacation too. I spend my free time trying craft beers, reading, skiing, and seeing live music. My husband and I are saving up for a month-long road trip through Ireland for next year to celebrate our 11-year wedding anniversary (will definitely be using airbnb during that trip!). 

Favorite movie: Good Will Hunting
Favorite book: So many--English major--but highly recommend The Book Thief and The Paris Wife

Downtown Asheville's Private Room International Youth Hostel since 2004.
The consistently highest rated & oldest standing Asheville Hostel. 
Keyed private rooms, shared lockable bathrooms. 
No bunks or dorm rooms. 
The Tiny House is the only room with a bathroom in the room.

Walk to anything downtown in less than 11 minutes!
Our properties are in the Central Business District.
3 blocks from the center of town; Vance monument, or Pritchard Park. 

Our mission has always been to be a simple, clean, safe, & affordable place for young travelers.

Children are permitted if supervised by parent.
We do not accept walk-up reservations
Please reserve online in advance.
We don't accept animals or pets.

We begin checking in scheduled reserved guests after 4 pm.

Rooms change often.
Even though the room you are checked into may not look exactly like the one in the picture:
1. A listing for a Queen bed will be a room with at least a Queen bed, sleeping together.
2. A listing for 2 Twin beds will be a room with at least two Twin beds, sleeping separately. 
3. A listing for the Tiny House is always the Tiny House, there is only one.

Although our Airbnb profile was created in 2012, we didn't go live until April 24th 2015. 

All Airbnb reservations require at least a two night minimum, two guest maximum, which helps us keep the price down & value up.

We will respond to reservation requests after 4 pm est if not earlier.

Reservations can span or depart Saturdays, but we are closed for check-ins on Saturdays.

Any changes to Airbnb reservations including; cancellations, date changes, refunds, extenuating circumstances, etc, must be initiated by you through Airbnb. Please do not ask us to make these types of changes for you, as we have very limited control over Airbnb's reservation system. We can only fully control our own reservation system.

For the past 7 years, I have owned and managed two very successful short term vacation rentals where guests occupied the entire space, yet the home remained void of me as a host. Most recently, I have changed directions, opening rooms in my home to travelers like yourself to offer comfortable, well-thought out spaces with a fun, eclectic vibe and all the comforts of home.

I am a high "D" personality type, a doer, a get-it-done type of girl. My "I" falls close second, and in good company, I have a lot to say and will use large gestures to make my point. I can't live without change, chocolate, earl grey tea, music and inspiring words. I prefer to surround myself with positive, driven people or those constantly moving forward to create their best life possible! 

I am a low-key host with a limited presence and one that allows you the freedom of use for the common areas and of course, your own personal space. I am confident that you will find Out on a Limb to exceed your expectations, where unlike most rentals, my experience in the business translates for you as an above average accommodation. 

Thank you for taking the time to read on and learn more about Out on a Limb. I appreciate the opportunity to be your host during your time in Asheville and look forward to our connection!

 My home is 10 yrs old, on a cul-de-sac with ample parking.  Sweet, quiet, safe neighborhood.  It has a split bedroom/open floor plan so you will have your own space on the opposite side of the house from my bedroom suite.  Tons of windows, so very light filled.

I enjoy hiking, camping, motorcycling, reading, playing games, dining and local music, especially bluegrass.  I also enjoy a huge range of professional bands and musicians from all eras. I really love books based in the south and have a large eclectic book collection.

I love to travel, mainly to tropical destinations, but am anxious to travel out west where my daughter is living.  I prefer to travel to areas farther from my home.  I would love to travel more!

I prefer non-chain locally owned restaurants, with everything from French cuisine to sushi.  Our loval restaurants here are amazing.  Lots of good dining for certain.

I am pretty easy going and open in my house.  I enjoy guests, but will respect your privacy.  Please let me know your favorite coffee, juice and drinks.  Cream and sugar choices, etc.  I want your immediate needs to be met.  I will have maps of surrounding areas as well as points of interests.  I will also have information on local goings on and events.  My house is located extremely convenient to all of the major thoroughfares, so it's quick and easy to get to your desired locations.

I want your visit to be as comfortable and pleasurable as possible, after all, it is your vacation time.  I am southern and we southerners love to be as friendly, accommodating and hospitable as possible.

Finally, my motto is to believe in now.  Live life with as little worries or regrets as possible. Right "Now" is all we are promised here on this beautiful planet, so I try to stay in it as much as possible.  Enjoy it.  Live to laugh as much as possible.
